title: Nicky Katt, Actor in ‘Boston Public,’ ‘Dazed and Confused,’ Dies at 54
description: Nicky Katt, who played teacher Harry Senate on “Boston Public” after starting as a child actor and going on to play an assortment of tough guys in movies including “Dazed and Confused” and “Boiler Room,” has died. He was 54. His death was reported by his friends and by attorney John Sloss, and reportedly occurred […]

title: Official Trailer for Neo-Noir Road Trip Horror 'A Desert' w/ David Yow
description: "Nothing happened, man! You're too easy to rile up." Dark Sky Films has debuted the trailer for a dark & depraved road trip horror film titled A Desert, marking the feature directorial debut of filmmaker Joshua Erkman. This originally premiered at the 2024 Tribeca Film Festival last year, then it played at FrightFest, Splat!FilmFest, and the Sitges Film Festival last fall. Arriving to watch in May in theaters. A past his prime photographer heads out on a road trip across the Southwest in hopes to recapture the magic & success of his previous work. Instead, he finds himself thrust into the dark & chaotic underbelly of America, unwittingly dragging his wife and a shady private detective into this nightmare with him. It stars David Yow as Harold, Kai Lennox, Sarah Lind, Zachary Ray Sherman, Rob Zabrecky, Ashley B. Smith, and Ashley B. Smith. Featuring a score by Ty Segall. With mostly good reviews, stating: "This gritty thriller by Erkman blends Hitchcockian mystery with the urbanoia chills of a Texas Chain Saw Massacre..." This looks freaky. Here's the official trailer (+ poster) for Joshua Erkman's horror film A Desert, direct from YouTube: A well-known photographer who is living his leanest years […]
author: Alex Billington

title: Review: 'Lost Wolves of Yellowstone' is One of the Best Docs of 2025
description: "Free-ranging wolves in Yellowstone - where are they going to go? What are they going to do?" 🐺 I can't start this review without admitting that I have loved wolves all of my life. When I was in third grade, I spent time during school lessons trying to convince a wolf sanctuary to bring a wolf down to our elementary school in Colorado so my class could meet one in person and learn more about them (it didn't happen – but I tried anyway). Anyone who knows me will not be surprised to hear me say that I loved this film about wolves and will now proclaim that it is one of the best documentaries of the year. Lost Wolves of Yellowstone is a brand new IMAX Original Documentary film, formerly known as Mollie's Pack. It premiered at the 2025 CPH:DOX Film Festival in Copenhagen, along with premieres at the American Conservation Film Festival & DC Environmental Film Festival in the US. A deeply moving, emotional, profoundly inspiring, completely riveting film telling two distinct, intertwined stories about wolves & humans and their intrinsic connection. Lost Wolves of Yellowstone is directed by acclaimed filmmaker Thomas Winston, known for nature docs including […]
author: Alex Billington
